page.title: 18Blackmoss House Thornley
page.content:
Blackmoss County House Hotel, Thornley is on land that was part of the Earl of Derby's estates, and occasionally the Earl lived there. The premises were burned down and rebuilt in the early 1900s but it remained a private house until 1981 when the present owners converted its three wings into an hotel. The clientele is varied, during the week it mostly caters for businessmen but at weekends it is used for private functions such as weddings and other celebrations.
The hotel is residential and therefore has the usual lounges, restaurants, bars, etc. but also offers a solarium, sauna and swimming pool to its guests. A dance room is available for the private functions. There is a staff of about ten, who are both full and part-time and mostly live locally.
